Comments_List: Learned a lot about different statistical techniques and the challenges of applying them to real data.
I learned how to direct my own Deep Learning project from start to end.
I learned a ton about Neural Nets and the difficulties of training certain architectures. I got a much better idea of what research in statistics looks like.

It's not a course, but it's extremely dependent on the advisor. It would be nice to let certain faculty list projects they would be willing to advise for students who are not as confident developing a topic.

You need to do it to graduate, but I would recommend people not going into research take the class. I was told the class didn't count, so I made the mistake of taking this. I am sort of happy I did in the end, but it's fine.
